headline: 450 Global CEOs Build Enduring Greatness at CEO Coaching International's Record-Breaking 2025 Make BIG Happen Summit
context: Jim Collins Headlines Weekend of Growth, Purpose, and Unstoppable Momentum with $200,000+ Raised for Charity:Water in Under 60 Seconds

,  /PRNewswire/ -- More than 450 powerhouse CEOs, entrepreneurs, and leaders from 18 countries gathered in Miami Beach this past weekend for CEO Coaching International's 2025 Make BIG Happen Summit. More than an event, the Summit was a movement for leaders committed to elevating their businesses, their teams, and themselves.

annotations.paragraph: The Summit achieved a record-breaking 9.2 out of 10 satisfaction rating, a $200,000 surge of generosity for Charity:Water in less than a minute, and a flood of momentum that attendees are already turning into massive results.
annotations.reason: Provides specific achievements and outcomes from the summit.

annotations.paragraph: As Marty Metro, Founder and CEO of UCB Environmental, shared, "After 30 years of attending conferences, I can say this was the best content and best-run event."
annotations.reason: Offers a testimonial that supports the event's success.

annotations.paragraph: "It exceeded my expectations," said John Durden, CEO of Red One Corporation. "I am walking away with actual items that will help me and my company grow."
annotations.reason: Provides a participant's perspective on the event's impact.

annotations.paragraph: A Masterclass in Enduring Greatness: Insights from Jim Collins
annotations.reason: Introduces a key session and speaker at the summit.

annotations.paragraph: At the heart of the Summit was an electrifying session with Jim Collins, the renowned author of Good to Great. Collins delivered a masterclass on building companies that endure beyond any market cycle. Not through luck, but through a relentless accumulation of momentum over time.
annotations.reason: Describes a significant session and its content, relevant to the summit's theme.

annotations.paragraph: "Every component of your flywheel must operate at a level of excellence," Collins told attendees. "If one piece falters, momentum stalls. Strengthen each link, and you create an unstoppable force."
annotations.reason: This paragraph includes a direct quote from Jim Collins, providing insight into his message at the summit.

annotations.paragraph: Collins emphasized that true greatness comes not from one-time events but from disciplined execution across every part of the organization, compounding success over years and decades.
annotations.reason: This paragraph summarizes Collins' key message about achieving greatness, relevant to the summit's theme.

annotations.paragraph: "Never underestimate how far a great flywheel can go," Collins concluded. "When you think you have made it, it is only a nice start."
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides another direct quote from Collins, reinforcing his message about continuous improvement.

annotations.paragraph: His session resonated deeply with attendees, earning an average 9.7 out of 10 rating, the highest score of the entire Summit.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific feedback on Collins' session, indicating its impact at the summit.

annotations.paragraph: A Powerful Community: Where Top CEOs Support Each Other

annotations.paragraph: Approximately 46% of attendees were first-timers, while 54% returned to reconnect, deepen relationships, and build on past momentum. Across every interaction, friendships, partnerships, and industry alliances were forged.
annotations.reason: Provides statistics and insights into the attendee demographics and networking outcomes.

annotations.paragraph: "The women's breakfast was my favorite part of the Summit," said Sara Pizarro, VP of Operations at Y Scouts. "It was inspiring to be around powerful women and to build real friendships."

annotations.paragraph: A Defining Moment of Purpose: $200,000 Raised for Charity:Water
annotations.reason: Highlights a significant achievement related to the summit's impact.

annotations.paragraph: The Summit's most moving moment came during Scott Harrison's session on founding Charity:Water. In a spontaneous surge of generosity, attendees pledged to fund 20 water wells, raising over $200,000 in under a minute.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific details about a significant event at the summit, contributing to the narrative of the summit's impact.

annotations.paragraph: "The Charity:Water session was amazing," said a participant. "The instant generosity showed what happens when leaders rally around something bigger than themselves."
annotations.reason: This paragraph includes a participant's quote that adds personal insight into the impact of the Charity:Water session.

annotations.paragraph: Extending the Momentum: Launch of Make BIG Happen Business Forums
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces a new initiative launched at the summit, contributing to the narrative of ongoing impact.

annotations.paragraph: The Summit also marked the launch of Make BIG Happen Business Forums, exclusive peer groups led by world-class coaches.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides details about the new business forums, which are a direct outcome of the summit.

annotations.paragraph: Over 150 executives enrolled within the first 48 hours, determined to carry the Summit's momentum into every quarter of 2025 and beyond.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific information about the immediate success and future impact of the business forums.

annotations.paragraph: Thank You to Our Strategic Partners

annotations.paragraph: CEO Coaching International extends its sincere thanks to the Diamond Strategic Partners who made the 2025 Summit possible: AccountingDepartment.com, Carson Wealth, HireBetter, Ironside Group, MyOutDesk, Preferred CFO, Premier M&A Advisors, STS Capital Partners, UBS, Waterstone Human Capital, and Wild Health.

annotations.paragraph: If you missed the learning opportunities, connections, and momentum at Summit 2025, it's not too late to join the movement. Visit: https://ceocoachinginternational.com/contact/
annotations.reason: This is promotional content and does not add to the main story.

annotations.paragraph: About CEO Coaching International
annotations.reason: This is a heading and does not provide any new information.

annotations.paragraph: CEO Coaching International works with CEOs and their leadership teams to achieve extraordinary results quarter after quarter, year after year. Known globally for its success in coaching growth-focused entrepreneurs to meaningful exits, the firm has coached more than 1,500+ CEOs and entrepreneurs across 100+ industries and 60 countries. Its coaches—former CEOs, presidents, and executives—have led businesses ranging from startups to over $10 billion, driving double-digit sales and profit growth, many culminating in eight, nine, or ten-figure exits.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides background information about CEO Coaching International, which is relevant to understanding the context of the summit.

annotations.paragraph: Companies that have worked with CEO Coaching International for two years or more have achieved an average revenue CAGR of 25.9%, nearly 3X the U.S. average, and an average EBITDA CAGR of 39.2%, more than 4X the national benchmark.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific data on the success of companies working with CEO Coaching International, which is relevant to the summit's focus on business growth.

annotations.paragraph: Discover how coaching can transform your leadership journey at ceocoachinginternational.com.
annotations.reason: This is a promotional statement directing readers to a website, not contributing new information about the summit.
